importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The start of Israel’s war on Gaza, marking a significant escalation in conflict and associated prisoner abuse reports.
The date of the article's publication, indicating the current state of ongoing allegations of torture and prisoner abuse.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from October 7, 2023, to the present, during which a significant rise in reported torture and deaths of Palestinian detainees has been documented.

keyTakeAways: More than 100 Palestinian prisoners have died in Israeli custody, with most bodies remaining unidentified and returned to Gaza with only numbers assigned.
Bodies show signs of torture, including missing limbs, burns, blindfolds, and handcuffs, suggesting execution while restrained—potentially constituting war crimes.
At least 75 Palestinian detainees have died since October 7, 2023, according to the United Nations.
A documented gang rape of a Palestinian prisoner at the Sde Teiman detention facility by Israeli guards was confirmed by verified video.
Prisoners released under the Gaza ceasefire deal show severe physical and psychological trauma, including loss of eyesight, emaciation, and long-term injuries.

Israeli prison system has been repeatedly described as a 'network of torture camps' by human rights groups like B’Tselem, with documented cases of torture, sexual assault, and denial of medical treatment.

One of the most prominent Palestinian detainees is Marwan Barghouti, who is serving multiple life sentences and has been subjected to harsh treatment, including beatings and threats by Israeli officials.
Far-right Israeli National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir, who oversees the prison system, has defended abusive practices, including showing Barghouti an electric chair and threatening him.
The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) did not comment on the condition of the bodies, while Israeli authorities remained silent on allegations.
Palestinian families are left in anguish due to lack of information about the fate of missing loved ones; many released detainees are severely injured or unrecognizable.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The article reports on widespread allegations of torture, abuse, and executions of Palestinian detainees held by Israel, including documented cases of gang rape, physical violence, and burning. Bodies returned to Gaza from Israeli prisons show signs of severe torture, such as missing limbs, burns, and restraints, with many deaths occurring while restrained. Over 100 Palestinian prisoners are believed to have died in Israeli custody since October 2023, with bodies often returned without names. The Gaza ceasefire deal facilitated the release of nearly 2,000 Palestinians, many of whom suffered long-term injuries and trauma from beatings and psychological torture. Key figures like Marwan Barghouti and Itamar Ben-Gvir are central to the allegations, with Ben-Gvir defending abusive prison practices. Human rights groups, including B’Tselem and Physicians for Human Rights Israel, have long documented systemic torture in Israeli prisons. Despite Israeli denials, international observers and medical experts confirm patterns of violence, including autopsies showing torture signs months after death. The article highlights a grave violation of international human rights law, with families left in despair and calls for urgent international investigations and accountability.
title: What we know about the torture, abuse of Palestinian prisoners by Israel
